solution_line_template: If Kim is currently {kim_current_age} years old, she will be {kim_current_age}+{years_later} =<<{kim_current_age}+{years_later}={kim_age_in_two_years}>>{kim_age_in_two_years} years old in two years.

In two years, Sandy will be three times as old as Kim, meaning Sandy will be {sandy_age_multiplier}*{kim_age_in_two_years} = <<{sandy_age_multiplier}*{kim_age_in_two_years}={sandy_age_in_two_years}>>{sandy_age_in_two_years} years old.

If Sandy's monthly phone bill expense is equal to ten times her age now, she pays {bill_multiplier}*{sandy_current_age} = ${bill_multiplier}*{sandy_current_age}={sandy_phone_bill}>>{sandy_phone_bill} in phone bill expense
